Articles.Content: Did nova say that Morz will have a thin atmosphere where parachutes would work but less efficiently ?
Well for starters, it's not called "Morz" but yes, you'd be right.

Well for starters, it's not called "Morz" but yes, you'd be right.

Well, at least he didn't call it Kars.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Kars

I actually gagged just from reading that.
I want a colored name too D:

I want a colored name too D:

You have one, it's blue. Nova, can you give approx. figures on the orbital altitudes of the different planets?
About the Kraken, if anyone has done travel outside kerbins SOI, i still feel some movement that i cant control, its not as bad but it will need a little more work
As a reminder, Nova does NOT want a "K" planet! Or "K" stuff anymore so Kars will not be the name for it. And Nova also said about having a "des" in it. Desilius maybe?

"* Added a button on the Tracking Station to terminate an ongong flight (prompts for confirmation)."

Will this work for unmanned debris or just controllable flights? If it does work for debris it could make cleaning up spent stages and whatnot a lot easier...

Desilius maybe?

That sounds rather good, does it have some special origin or was it just an idea of yours?

That sounds rather good, does it have some special origin or was it just an idea of yours?

I thought of that actually, I think it should sound Greek (I think it's Greek) since Mars is called from the God of war. Desilius is made up. It reminds me of something though...

I think if it's something like that people will end up calling it 'Des' like it's a happy-go-lucky chubby bloke playing darts in an east end pub. I'm sure it'll be christened something wholly suitable and appropriate to the kerbal space program universe.

If you rendezvous two craft, do you think we'll be able to IVA and wave at each other through the windows?

I would love to see 2 moons orbiting on the same orbit at a very close range.... If you were orbiting one of the moons the other would be so close you could get captured in the seconds gravity well and get pulled in so your orbit would be like a figure 8.

I quoted FishyFishy.....

I would love to see 2 moons orbiting on the same orbit at a very close range.... If you were orbiting one of the moons the other would be so close you could get captured in the seconds gravity well and get pulled in so your orbit would be like a figure 8.

When I had intended to quote Paprika.....

I think if it's something like that people will end up calling it 'Des' like it's a happy-go-lucky chubby bloke playing darts in an east end pub. I'm sure it'll be christened something wholly suitable and appropriate to the kerbal space program universe.

While I like that name and your description, I'm sure Nova has a list of all suggested names and is deliberately not going to use any of them, so it's probably best not to make suggestions as the list of names not guessed must be getting quite small by now

Edited August 17, 2012 by sal_vager
I didn't suggest any names.... I gave an idea...
So, what about "Nalnet"? Sounds like a moon name for me.
Seems like I managed to quote the wrong person, I'll fix it
My bets are still on Egar.

Just wondering, Will heat be implemented in 0.17? I.E. If you get near the sun or fall into the gas giant will your ship overheat over time? Or will it just explode as soon as you cross a "Barrier" of sorts?

Just wondering, Will heat be implemented in 0.17? I.E. If you get near the sun or fall into the gas giant will your ship overheat over time? Or will it just explode as soon as you cross a "Barrier" of sorts?

I don't know about Kerbol, but you will explode if you fall deep enough into the gas giant.

While I like that name and your description, I'm sure Nova has a list of all suggested names and is deliberately not going to use any of them, so it's probably best not to make suggestions as the list of names not guessed must be getting quite small by now

I wasn't trying to make a suggestion, I was trying to say what you said, but I went about it in a very garbled and incomprehensible way. I need to read what I write in future to make sure I don't spout any more nonsense, haha. Sorry for any confusion.
My question is how they managed to kill the Kraken. I quite liked those fancy descriptions of what they did and how. With the mighty Kraken slain, no one knows how.

Red in Finnish is punainen, puna is a shorter version for it. But punades? despun?
How about Pirodes? Though, personally I like Eredes
